result.execSummary:
The defendant Maria Isabel Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install (2+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maria Isabel Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:57 PM: Defendant Maria Isabel Rodriguez in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and SPD confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (OAR 3):  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Argument by DA - slight deviation from guidelines.  Argument by SPD - argues for imposition of costs onlly.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Imposes  6 days WCJ, GT Huber and 1 day TS credit - Report: 6/1/16 @ 8:00 PM, Court Costs w/Surcharge - No sample ordered however, previously provided.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Maria Isabel Rodriguez
Current: 1600 Briggs, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 220 Northwestern Ave, Wautoma, WI 54982

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:06 p.m. Defendant Maria Isabel Rodriguez in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting a Sig Bond based on the fact that the DE is currently on a PO Hold. Atty Szilagyi takes no position as to bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
